info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 25 at 4:47PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT SOUTHERN ERIE COUNTY AND FAR NORTHERN CHAUTAUQUA COUNTY... HAZARDS...A band of heavy lake effect snow accompanied by winds of up to 35 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This band of heavy snow is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 445 PM EST, a band of heavy snow extended from Silver Creek, to Hamburg, to West Seneca, to Alden. The band will remain nearly stationary through this evening, with only minor shifts in placement expected. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... South Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Lackawanna, Depew, Lancaster, Hamburg, East Aurora, Evans, Elma, Eden, Marilla, Orchard Park, Silver Creek, Alden, Blasdell, Angola, North Collins, Woodlawn Beach State Park and Derby. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 54 and 58. SAFETY INFO... Travel in this band will be extremely difficult. The snow will accumulate so rapidly that it will be extremely difficult for the road crews to keep the roads clear. Blowing and drifting snow will lower visibility below a quarter mile in this band. &&
